column4: Hello, does anyone has any experience running xubuntu on a Pentium 3 with 477 Mhz?
or anything around 477Mhz
no, but I've got xubuntu on a Celeron 300
you still need good amounts of RAM -- I've 192MB on that machine and it runs well enough
ok i think that is my problem then, i only have 64meg of ram
can you get your hands on some extra RAM? Shouldn't be too expensive these days...
yep. I already ordered them on my work ( i work in a local hardware store) got 2 rigs of 256mb of ram for like 60 euro
what do you mean?
the alternate install CD won't be of any use to you
ah yes. what window manager does that alternate cd have?
it's for installing the non-graphical way -- it still provides a full gnome install with metacity by default
i need the desktop environment, because it's on my laptop ( IBM Thinkpad 390x), doing light office work on it.
only CLI wont do
(dthacker, linux1) I take it all back -- there is an alternate Xubuntu install CD that works on machines with 64MB (http://www.xubuntu.org/get)
alternate install means that only the installer is nongraphical. It still installs Gnome, Xfce or KDE, respectively
hmm i had that problem, that it would install with the 'normal' ubuntu disc, then i tried the xubuntu and that worked.
*would not
oh, so you did manage to install Xubuntu? I misread your first question then.
yes :D, im running it now atm. but with crappy memory :P
well, the 256MB you're getting will remove that bottleneck.
all the better ;)
well im off, thanks for the help :)
